snippet: The Health and Human Services study said that caregivers often do not recognize what harms patients.
abstract: Study by the Department of Health and Human Services says that hospital employees recognize and report only one out of seven errors, accidents and other events that harm Medicare patients while they are hospitalized; even after hospitals investigate preventable injuries and infections that have been reported, they rarely change their practices to prevent repetition.
lead_paragraph: The Health and Human Services study said that caregivers often do not recognize what harms patients.

headline.seo: Study of Medicare Patients Finds Most Hospital Errors Unreported
headline.main: Report Finds Most Errors at Hospitals Go Unreported
headline.print_headline: Report Finds Most Errors At Hospitals Unreported
